intro: Brochoneura dardainei, commonly known as the Dardaine's brochoneura, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
